title: 20 Best Early Black Friday Vacuum Deals 2024 for Sparkling Floors
description: Cordless? Handheld? Robotic? We have you covered with all the best vacuum promotions that are already live
author: Sarah Madaus, Will Porter
excerpt: Cordless? Handheld? Robotic? We have you covered with all the best early Black Friday vacuum deals that are already live. Shop Dyson, Shark, Roomba, and more
text: Wondering what kind of vacuum makes the most sense for you? Check out our guide here.Best Early Black Friday Stick Vacuum DealsDyson V8 Absolute Cordless Vacuum First GenerationDon’t take our word for it: The Dyson V8 earned a spot in AD's 2021 Awards thanks to not one but two nominees. According to designer Leah Ring, “the Dyson V8 cordless vacuum changed my life, and I will never go back to a corded vacuum again. Spending so much time inside, I find keeping a tidier place helps me focus more when I’m working, and the convenience of the cordless Dyson makes vacuuming not feel like such a chore.” Fellow designer Ryan Belli called the V8 an “emotional support robot” and says, “My dog sheds like nothing on this planet and without this lovely machine I would lose my mind.” Another Dyson V8 is also on sale (keep on reading) but if you want something with a little more power, go for this model. The Dyson V8 Absolute is over $200 off, and it’ll come with two different vacuum heads instead of the V8’s one as well as different attachment.Dyson V8 Origin VacuumThis one is hot off the presses from Target's early Black Friday sale. The V8 origin is a classic cordless model that can do it all with a reasonable price tag (even more reasonable now that it’s $130 off). If you’re a bit of Goldilocks when it comes to vacuums, this middle of the road Dyson is the perfect fit for a deep clean without any unnecessary accoutrements.Shark Cordless Pet Plus Lightweight Stick VacuumThis Shark cordless vacuum is one of our go-to picks for hardwood floors, largely because of its self-cleaning ability. The brushroll and silicone PowerFins sweep up debris and pet hair without tangling. The floor nozzle has an LED light that helps one AD editor, “find more dirt than I would care to know about.” The HEPA filter protects against allergens, and it's easy to empty the dustbin without getting sneezy. The vacuum also comes with two attachments, including a crevice tool for all the nooks and crannies.SAMSUNG BESPOKE Jet Cordless Stick Vacuum Cleaner w/ Clean StationFor those on the hunt for a sleek and stylish vacuum that won’t be an eyesore in your living room, feast your gaze on the Samsung Bespoke Jet. Contributor Terri Williams gave the Bespoke Jet a whirl earlier this year and found it works just as beautifully as it is designed. “There’s more to the machine than just looks,” Williams said. The machine rests in a self-emptying cleaning station that doubles as a charging dock. It’s got a super high wattage at 210 W, while also staying pretty lightweight and thus provides a super easy maneuver. “The combination of looks and performance make the Bespoke Jet Cordless Stick Vacuum Cleaner my favorite new cleaning machine.” Now at a big markdown, this is definitely one of the best early Black Friday sales out there right now.Dyson V11 Extra Cordless Vacuum CleanerLarger spaces lend themselves to a vacuum with a wide head for easy, efficient cleaning. This Dyson model has an adjustable power trigger so you can add more suction where you need it, and it offers a full hour of runtime. Like most Dyson stick vacuums, it can be easily converted to a handheld vacuum, too, for cleaning furniture, cars, and more.Dyson V12 Detect Slim+ Cordless Vacuum CleanerSo many Dyson deals, so little time. This particularly heavy duty model runs for 60 minutes and has night vision and a microfiber head. Our contributor Terri Williams reviewed the model when testing for hardwood floor vacuums: “The Dyson V12 Detect Slim Cordless Stick Vacuum has an angled laser that detects a surprising amount of dust particles on the floor,” Williams says. “And if that’s not enough, the Dyson cordless vacuum cleaner has a color-coded LCD screen to reveal the types of particles being sucked up by the deep suction motor and passing through the detangling motor-bar cleaner head.”Best Early Black Friday Robot Vacuum DealsRoborock S8 Pro Ultra Robot Vacuum and Mop ComboIf you want a vac that literally does everything, this wet/dry vacuum from Roborock is the way to go. It’s self-cleaning, self-emptying and even has a water reservoir that will refill the robot with mop water for you—pretty much the definition of set-it-and-forget-it. The bag at the dock holds seven weeks of dust, and you can store enough water in it to mop over 3,000 square feet without refilling. The Roborock companion app lets you manage everything from your phone and you can enable Siri, Alexa, or Google Assistant to go even more hands-off.iRobot Roomba 694 Robot VacuumiRobot knows a thing or two about making the best robot vacuums. This model connects to your Wi-Fi and runs on your schedule so you can come home to clean floors every day (if that’s your thing). It has a 90-minute run time and a three-stage cleaning system to ensure a squeaky clean home.ECOVACS DEEBOT X1 Omni Robot Vacuum and Mop ComboA behemoth of a robo vac, this Deebot works just as cool as it looks. The towering all-in-one Omni station alleviates one bit of the cleaning process and the robo vac itself even has voice control, allowing you to tell your vacuuming device exactly what you want it to clean and where. Score this advanced piece of tech for 27% off while the discount lasts, as early Amazon Black Friday deals are constantly changing.eufy by Anker BoostIQ RoboVac 30CAnother robot vacuum deal, we recommended Eufy’s RoboVac X8 Hybrid Robot Vacuum as the best option for pet hair, so it’s safe to say this slightly slimmer version would suit a similar purpose. The Eufy 11S cleans relatively quietly, has a 100-minute run time, and features BoostIQ technology that triggers an ultra-powerful suction when a deeper clean is needed.Shark RV1001AE IQ Robot Self-Empty XLThe Shark IQ Self-Empty Base Robot Vacuum won the title of Best Overall Robot Vacuum for Hardwood Floors from our list of 14 thoroughly tested machines. This smart, self-emptying machine can hold up to a month’s worth of dust and dirt. It can be programmed from your phone for easy cleaning, and it’s also self-charging. “[The IQ] has everything I wanted—and more—when searching for the best vacuums for hardwood floors,” Williams says. And—enter drumroll.Best Early Black Friday Corded and Upright Vacuum DealsShark NV360 Navigator Lift-Away Deluxe Upright VacuumIf you’re more of an upright vacuum person, you can’t go wrong with Shark’s Navigator. It has a 0.9-quart capacity (larger than a Dyson), and works with a HEPA filter to trap dust and allergens inside. The body of the vacuum also detaches from the foot, so you can clean high or hard-to-reach corners with ease. And because it’s corded, you’ll never have to worry about charging—or having the battery die in the middle of a cleaning session.Shark CZ351 Pet Canister VacuumAnother killer deal from Shark: you can get this bagless canister vacuum that self-cleans, provides deep suction, can seamlessly move from room to room thanks to the canister’s attached wheels, and a flexible wand to clean in hard-to-reach places for 25% off.Shark Rocket Ultra-Light Corded Stick VacuumEven on sale, Dysons aren’t exactly budget-friendly. Shark’s lightweight Rocket model, however, offers similar functionality for just a third of the price: It’s bagless, under nine pounds, handles all floor types from carpet to hardwood, and easily converts into a handheld vacuum. It’s also corded, which means you’ll never have to worry about charging. Another perk: Even on sale, it still comes with a five-year warranty.Shark Vertex DuoClean PowerFin Upright VacuumShark’s Vertex DuoClean PowerFins Cordless Stick Vacuum is also a real find! This multi-use cleaner can go from full-length vacuum to handheld by just detaching the top. With a self-cleaning brush roll and tapered nozzle that’s perfect for cleaning tight spaces, this handy gadget will let you clean faster and more efficiently.Best Early Black Friday Wet/Dry Vacuum DealsBISSELL CrossWave Cordless Max All in One Wet-Dry Vacuum Cleaner and MopWhile the Bissell CrossWave Max might have the silhouette of your average vacuum, this isn’t just any old cleaner. It’s cordless, also mops, works on hardwood floors and rugs, automatically self-cleans, and is currently half off.BISSELL Crosswave Pet Pro All in One Wet Dry Vacuum Cleaner and MopAnd if you want a model that’s specifically targeted towards tackling pet hair, then take the CrossWave Pet for a spin. It’s got a tangle-free brush roll, pet hair strainer, and a PET multi-surface formula to help maximize cleanliness despite the mess your furry friend (or friends) might bring to your house.Best Early Black Friday Handheld Vacuum DealsShark WANDVAC Cord-Free Handheld VacuumThe Shark Wandavac Handheld Vacuum is quite slim, which makes it ideal for tight spaces, like cleaning the counter space in between my appliances and in the corners of rooms. The filtration technology grabs everything from dust to larger objects. And because it’s so light and compact, I can store it practically anywhere to charge.ONEPWR Dust Chaser Cordless Handheld Vacuum and KitYou thought Hoover wasn’t going to make the best early Black Friday vacuums list? The vacuum brand that is now used to describe everything from a baseball shortstop to a crumb-loving dog is still at it with the ONEPWR cordless handheld vacuum. Ideal for hard to reach spots around your house or in your car, this vacuum has a built-in extender and uses a HEPA filter to keep almost all dust particles out of the air.BLACK+DECKER 20V Max Handheld Vacuum, Cordless, GreyIf you’re into DIY or know how to find your way around a Home Depot, you probably know Black+Decker. The hardware store stalwart does more than make affordable drills, it also makes this snappy-looking little handheld vac. The pivoting nozzle allows you to get into those places that other vacuums simply can’t reach, making this ideal for pesky nooks and crannies.What kind of vacuum should you buy?Cordless StickIf ease-of-use and versatility are a must-have around the house, odds are you’ll get the most from a stick vacuum. They’re powerful enough for cleaning up big messes but are also ideal for the routine maintenance that comes from having a pet or living in an area with a lot of dust and allergens. They also tend to be more lightweight than their corded counterparts, if mobility is an issue for you. In 2024, many of them have battery power strong enough to run up to an hour uninterrupted and have suction capable of cleaning any room and any surface, without the inconvenience of a cord. The most popular stick vacuum brand is probably Dyson, but these days there are options at all price points, including Shark, LG, Samsung, or Roborock.RobotIf getting out the vacuum each evening is a slog or you’d rather have someone else take care of messes, just have a robot do it. Robot vacuums are the ideal smart home companion, running on a predetermined schedule and seeking out the messiest areas without any guidance. Many of them even clean themselves and empty out their own dustbins, meaning you can literally set it and forget it. iRobot’s Roombas are the most popular version (and basically the Kleenex of robot vacs), but you can find great picks from Samsung, Shark, and more. Plus, you might even see your cat riding on it someday, and who can pass up that opportunity?Corded and UprightNot all corded vacuums are upright vacuums, but if you are seeking an upright vac for its power and capacity, odds are, it needs a constant power source to achieve results. They’re great for homes with pets that shed heavily or track lots of dirt into the house, but can be tricky to work with given the restriction of an electrical cord and their cumbersome design. If you want to be sure you can get everything with one pass, though, an upright might be the pick for you. There are also corded stick vacuum options, if lightweight mobility is a draw.Wet/DryA Wet/Dry Vacuum is a godsend for those of us who live in homes with no carpet—some things just can’t (or shouldn’t) be vacuumed. An ideal combination of a mop-and-bucket and a Swiffer-style wet-or-dry mop, a wet/dry vacuum utilizes the suction and rotation power of a vacuum with just enough moisture to keep things from getting sopping wet. Some will even detect if mopping or vacuuming is needed and can toggle back and forth automatically. If you’ve still got a conventional mop at home, chuck it out.HandheldKeeping a handheld vacuum is perhaps not quite as necessary as it once was given the proliferation of stick vacuums that come with half a dozen attachments, but even the Dyson-obsessed homeowner can find use for a simple handheld vacuum. They’re great for cleaning up drywall dust after a weekend-DIY project or cleaning delicate home decor. You can even keep one in your car if you’re prone to spills.
html:
Wondering what kind of vacuum makes the most sense for you? Check out our guide here.

Best Early Black Friday Stick Vacuum Deals

Dyson V8 Absolute Cordless Vacuum First Generation

Don’t take our word for it: The Dyson V8 earned a spot in AD's 2021 Awards thanks to not one but two nominees. According to designer Leah Ring, “the Dyson V8 cordless vacuum changed my life, and I will never go back to a corded vacuum again. Spending so much time inside, I find keeping a tidier place helps me focus more when I’m working, and the convenience of the cordless Dyson makes vacuuming not feel like such a chore.” Fellow designer Ryan Belli called the V8 an “emotional support robot” and says, “My dog sheds like nothing on this planet and without this lovely machine I would lose my mind.” Another Dyson V8 is also on sale (keep on reading) but if you want something with a little more power, go for this model. The Dyson V8 Absolute is over $200 off, and it’ll come with two different vacuum heads instead of the V8’s one as well as different attachment.

Dyson V8 Origin Vacuum

This one is hot off the presses from Target's early Black Friday sale. The V8 origin is a classic cordless model that can do it all with a reasonable price tag (even more reasonable now that it’s $130 off). If you’re a bit of Goldilocks when it comes to vacuums, this middle of the road Dyson is the perfect fit for a deep clean without any unnecessary accoutrements.

Shark Cordless Pet Plus Lightweight Stick Vacuum

This Shark cordless vacuum is one of our go-to picks for hardwood floors, largely because of its self-cleaning ability. The brushroll and silicone PowerFins sweep up debris and pet hair without tangling. The floor nozzle has an LED light that helps one AD editor, “find more dirt than I would care to know about.” The HEPA filter protects against allergens, and it's easy to empty the dustbin without getting sneezy. The vacuum also comes with two attachments, including a crevice tool for all the nooks and crannies.

SAMSUNG BESPOKE Jet Cordless Stick Vacuum Cleaner w/ Clean Station

For those on the hunt for a sleek and stylish vacuum that won’t be an eyesore in your living room, feast your gaze on the Samsung Bespoke Jet. Contributor Terri Williams gave the Bespoke Jet a whirl earlier this year and found it works just as beautifully as it is designed. “There’s more to the machine than just looks,” Williams said. The machine rests in a self-emptying cleaning station that doubles as a charging dock. It’s got a super high wattage at 210 W, while also staying pretty lightweight and thus provides a super easy maneuver. “The combination of looks and performance make the Bespoke Jet Cordless Stick Vacuum Cleaner my favorite new cleaning machine.” Now at a big markdown, this is definitely one of the best early Black Friday sales out there right now.

Dyson V11 Extra Cordless Vacuum Cleaner

Larger spaces lend themselves to a vacuum with a wide head for easy, efficient cleaning. This Dyson model has an adjustable power trigger so you can add more suction where you need it, and it offers a full hour of runtime. Like most Dyson stick vacuums, it can be easily converted to a handheld vacuum, too, for cleaning furniture, cars, and more.

Dyson V12 Detect Slim+ Cordless Vacuum Cleaner

So many Dyson deals, so little time. This particularly heavy duty model runs for 60 minutes and has night vision and a microfiber head. Our contributor Terri Williams reviewed the model when testing for hardwood floor vacuums: “The Dyson V12 Detect Slim Cordless Stick Vacuum has an angled laser that detects a surprising amount of dust particles on the floor,” Williams says. “And if that’s not enough, the Dyson cordless vacuum cleaner has a color-coded LCD screen to reveal the types of particles being sucked up by the deep suction motor and passing through the detangling motor-bar cleaner head.”

Best Early Black Friday Robot Vacuum Deals

Roborock S8 Pro Ultra Robot Vacuum and Mop Combo

If you want a vac that literally does everything, this wet/dry vacuum from Roborock is the way to go. It’s self-cleaning, self-emptying and even has a water reservoir that will refill the robot with mop water for you—pretty much the definition of set-it-and-forget-it. The bag at the dock holds seven weeks of dust, and you can store enough water in it to mop over 3,000 square feet without refilling. The Roborock companion app lets you manage everything from your phone and you can enable Siri, Alexa, or Google Assistant to go even more hands-off.

iRobot Roomba 694 Robot Vacuum

iRobot knows a thing or two about making the best robot vacuums. This model connects to your Wi-Fi and runs on your schedule so you can come home to clean floors every day (if that’s your thing). It has a 90-minute run time and a three-stage cleaning system to ensure a squeaky clean home.

ECOVACS DEEBOT X1 Omni Robot Vacuum and Mop Combo

A behemoth of a robo vac, this Deebot works just as cool as it looks. The towering all-in-one Omni station alleviates one bit of the cleaning process and the robo vac itself even has voice control, allowing you to tell your vacuuming device exactly what you want it to clean and where. Score this advanced piece of tech for 27% off while the discount lasts, as early Amazon Black Friday deals are constantly changing.

eufy by Anker BoostIQ RoboVac 30C

Another robot vacuum deal, we recommended Eufy’s RoboVac X8 Hybrid Robot Vacuum as the best option for pet hair, so it’s safe to say this slightly slimmer version would suit a similar purpose. The Eufy 11S cleans relatively quietly, has a 100-minute run time, and features BoostIQ technology that triggers an ultra-powerful suction when a deeper clean is needed.

Shark RV1001AE IQ Robot Self-Empty XL

The Shark IQ Self-Empty Base Robot Vacuum won the title of Best Overall Robot Vacuum for Hardwood Floors from our list of 14 thoroughly tested machines. This smart, self-emptying machine can hold up to a month’s worth of dust and dirt. It can be programmed from your phone for easy cleaning, and it’s also self-charging. “[The IQ] has everything I wanted—and more—when searching for the best vacuums for hardwood floors,” Williams says. And—enter drumroll.

Best Early Black Friday Corded and Upright Vacuum Deals

Shark NV360 Navigator Lift-Away Deluxe Upright Vacuum

If you’re more of an upright vacuum person, you can’t go wrong with Shark’s Navigator. It has a 0.9-quart capacity (larger than a Dyson), and works with a HEPA filter to trap dust and allergens inside. The body of the vacuum also detaches from the foot, so you can clean high or hard-to-reach corners with ease. And because it’s corded, you’ll never have to worry about charging—or having the battery die in the middle of a cleaning session.

Shark CZ351 Pet Canister Vacuum

Another killer deal from Shark: you can get this bagless canister vacuum that self-cleans, provides deep suction, can seamlessly move from room to room thanks to the canister’s attached wheels, and a flexible wand to clean in hard-to-reach places for 25% off.

Shark Rocket Ultra-Light Corded Stick Vacuum

Even on sale, Dysons aren’t exactly budget-friendly. Shark’s lightweight Rocket model, however, offers similar functionality for just a third of the price: It’s bagless, under nine pounds, handles all floor types from carpet to hardwood, and easily converts into a handheld vacuum. It’s also corded, which means you’ll never have to worry about charging. Another perk: Even on sale, it still comes with a five-year warranty.

Shark Vertex DuoClean PowerFin Upright Vacuum

Shark’s Vertex DuoClean PowerFins Cordless Stick Vacuum is also a real find! This multi-use cleaner can go from full-length vacuum to handheld by just detaching the top. With a self-cleaning brush roll and tapered nozzle that’s perfect for cleaning tight spaces, this handy gadget will let you clean faster and more efficiently.

Best Early Black Friday Wet/Dry Vacuum Deals

BISSELL CrossWave Cordless Max All in One Wet-Dry Vacuum Cleaner and Mop

While the Bissell CrossWave Max might have the silhouette of your average vacuum, this isn’t just any old cleaner. It’s cordless, also mops, works on hardwood floors and rugs, automatically self-cleans, and is currently half off.

BISSELL Crosswave Pet Pro All in One Wet Dry Vacuum Cleaner and Mop

And if you want a model that’s specifically targeted towards tackling pet hair, then take the CrossWave Pet for a spin. It’s got a tangle-free brush roll, pet hair strainer, and a PET multi-surface formula to help maximize cleanliness despite the mess your furry friend (or friends) might bring to your house.

Best Early Black Friday Handheld Vacuum Deals

Shark WANDVAC Cord-Free Handheld Vacuum

The Shark Wandavac Handheld Vacuum is quite slim, which makes it ideal for tight spaces, like cleaning the counter space in between my appliances and in the corners of rooms. The filtration technology grabs everything from dust to larger objects. And because it’s so light and compact, I can store it practically anywhere to charge.

ONEPWR Dust Chaser Cordless Handheld Vacuum and Kit

You thought Hoover wasn’t going to make the best early Black Friday vacuums list? The vacuum brand that is now used to describe everything from a baseball shortstop to a crumb-loving dog is still at it with the ONEPWR cordless handheld vacuum. Ideal for hard to reach spots around your house or in your car, this vacuum has a built-in extender and uses a HEPA filter to keep almost all dust particles out of the air.

BLACK+DECKER 20V Max Handheld Vacuum, Cordless, Grey

If you’re into DIY or know how to find your way around a Home Depot, you probably know Black+Decker. The hardware store stalwart does more than make affordable drills, it also makes this snappy-looking little handheld vac. The pivoting nozzle allows you to get into those places that other vacuums simply can’t reach, making this ideal for pesky nooks and crannies.

What kind of vacuum should you buy?

  • Cordless Stick
    If ease-of-use and versatility are a must-have around the house, odds are you’ll get the most from a stick vacuum. They’re powerful enough for cleaning up big messes but are also ideal for the routine maintenance that comes from having a pet or living in an area with a lot of dust and allergens. They also tend to be more lightweight than their corded counterparts, if mobility is an issue for you. In 2024, many of them have battery power strong enough to run up to an hour uninterrupted and have suction capable of cleaning any room and any surface, without the inconvenience of a cord. The most popular stick vacuum brand is probably Dyson, but these days there are options at all price points, including Shark, LG, Samsung, or Roborock.
  • Robot
    If getting out the vacuum each evening is a slog or you’d rather have someone else take care of messes, just have a robot do it. Robot vacuums are the ideal smart home companion, running on a predetermined schedule and seeking out the messiest areas without any guidance. Many of them even clean themselves and empty out their own dustbins, meaning you can literally set it and forget it. iRobot’s Roombas are the most popular version (and basically the Kleenex of robot vacs), but you can find great picks from Samsung, Shark, and more. Plus, you might even see your cat riding on it someday, and who can pass up that opportunity?
  • Corded and Upright
    Not all corded vacuums are upright vacuums, but if you are seeking an upright vac for its power and capacity, odds are, it needs a constant power source to achieve results. They’re great for homes with pets that shed heavily or track lots of dirt into the house, but can be tricky to work with given the restriction of an electrical cord and their cumbersome design. If you want to be sure you can get everything with one pass, though, an upright might be the pick for you. There are also corded stick vacuum options, if lightweight mobility is a draw.
  • Wet/Dry
    A Wet/Dry Vacuum is a godsend for those of us who live in homes with no carpet—some things just can’t (or shouldn’t) be vacuumed. An ideal combination of a mop-and-bucket and a Swiffer-style wet-or-dry mop, a wet/dry vacuum utilizes the suction and rotation power of a vacuum with just enough moisture to keep things from getting sopping wet. Some will even detect if mopping or vacuuming is needed and can toggle back and forth automatically. If you’ve still got a conventional mop at home, chuck it out.
  • Handheld
    Keeping a handheld vacuum is perhaps not quite as necessary as it once was given the proliferation of stick vacuums that come with half a dozen attachments, but even the Dyson-obsessed homeowner can find use for a simple handheld vacuum. They’re great for cleaning up drywall dust after a weekend-DIY project or cleaning delicate home decor. You can even keep one in your car if you’re prone to spills.
